description: Mentioned only by Audsley, who cites it as a form of Flûte Harmonique found at 2' pitch in the Récit-Écho Expressif division of the organ in the Royal Church of Saint-Denis near Paris, constructed by Cavaillé-Coll in 1841. Osiris, however, lists this stop as Octavin Harmonique, and contains no examples of Flûte Octavin Harmonique.
